story: Vivek Rai shared a post to Metakgp's Timeline.
message: Vivek Rai shared a post to Metakgp's Timeline. Hola folks! We've crossed 2000 likes - Thanks for your love. :-) As a token of thanks from our side, we'd like to announce our giveaway : The top 3 contributors to projects of Metakgp in Kharagpur Open Source Society's Kharagpur Winter of Code (KWoC) 2016, will be given a free Metakgp Hoodie each. This giveaway is applicable only for contributors who are from IIT Kharagpur, due to logistical reasons.

Hola folks! We've crossed 2000 likes - Thanks for your love. :-)

As a token of thanks from our side, we'd like to announce our giveaway : The top 3 contributors to projects of Metakgp in Kharagpur Open Source Society's Kharagpur Winter of Code (KWoC) 2016, will be given a free Metakgp Hoodie each.

This giveaway is applicable only for contributors who are from IIT Kharagpur, due to logistical reasons.

Hola folks! We've crossed 2000 likes - Thanks for your love. :-)

This giveaway is applicable only for contributors who are from IIT Kharagpur, due to logistical reasons.

This giveaway is applicable only for contributors who are from IIT Kharagpur, due to logistical reasons.

Kickstart your end semester exam preparation with MFQP. Get previous year papers from the library, and a few papers that were contributed by students!

10 days from now, when you are done with all your exams, don't forget to send us your papers at metakgp-qp@googlegroups.com.

Ahoy, folks. It's that time of the year again. Our ammunitions have been designed, and you can order Metakgp's Tees & Hoodies. Fill up the sheets below -

For Hoodie : https://goo.gl/forms/29HWz6erfepmRw8z2
For Tee : https://goo.gl/forms/usWR50RyKfDFVqpK2

These sheets are available to be filled, till 17/11/16 midnight. 

P.S - Cost of individual Hoodie / Tee depends on the total quantity ordered, and will be communicated to all the buyers. However, the maximum price can be understood as Rs 749 for Hoodie, and Rs 499 for Tee.

P.P.S - Yes, payment has to be done before we place the order and No, we don't accept 500 , 1000 Rs notes.

Happy ordering, folks.

Sometimes a little help can take us way forward. Ankur Agarwal (placecom 2015-2016), Kunal Jain and Vivek Aithal compiled the best practices and resources from some the students who got job offers, in various sectors. Each section contains answers to the following questions by successful candidates.

1.    What was the general interview process for most companies of this sector? Please mention the number of rounds and the nature of the interview process.

2.    What are some of the FAQs that you faced and think students must definitely prepare for?

3.    What are things students can do from now until December to maximise their chances of getting through a company in this sector?

4.    List resources you found useful/necessary to be successful in interviews

        a. Must do resources [Compulsory reads]
        b. Advanced resources [They are not required for all companies, but will improve chances in top tier firms]
        c. Auxiliary read [They are not compulsory, but will definitely help]

https://wiki.metakgp.org/w/Placement_Interview_Experiences

Ahoy, folks. We came across a well-written guide on "How to prepare for Financial Risk Management" on our Wiki recently, and wanted to share the same with you all.

Special thanks to Ritesh Saraogi, for writing this guide with his own initiative. We're sure many Finance aspirants from each batch will benefit from this guide.

Link to guide : https://wiki.metakgp.org/w/How_to_prepare_for_FRM
#HowTo

Greetings, fine citizens of the realm! Are you tired of missing important KGPian notifications on facebook, amidst various other groups / memes? This season, Metakgp would like to introduce you to our savior - explore the KGPian facebook timeline made by our very own Naarad Muni.

Check out Naarad on naarad.metakgp.org. If you would like Naarad Muni to add / remove your group from its tracking, don't hesitate to ping us. Also, for the coffee-loving developers out there, follow the developments of Naarad at https://github.com/metakgp/naarad-source

Kudos to those fine citizens of the realm who have already contributed to the Paper Collection Drive! For those haven't contributed yet, we request you again to submit your mid-semester question papers - keeping in mind that even a single paper could help out a large batch of existing and future students - especially with the Library site going down regularly this time.

Here's how you can contribute - Click, Upload & Send.

(1) Take picture(s) of your question paper
(2) Visit http://metakgp.github.io/mfqp-source/ and click the upload button
(3) Attach your images in the mail, and send the mail.

Never go to an exam without having had a look at the previous year's paper! Let's all work together in order to achieve this goal.

Have a great week ahead. And awesome Durga Puja hols ahead of that. That's all folks!

Greetings, fine citizens of the realm! We hope your mid-semester exams went well.

As the library site was down for most part of mid-semester exams, our site MFQP was also rendered to be down for the first few days, but we found a way out so that we could keep serving papers to everyone in KGP! Now, let's all contribute, and increase the papers MFQP has. Our Paper Collection Drive starts today! We request everyone to submit their mid-semester question papers.

Here's how you can contribute - Click, Upload & Send.

1. Take a picture of your question paper
2. Write Subject Code in email
3. Send to metakgp-qp@googlegroups.com

And, do visit http://metakgp.github.io/mfqp-source/ 

Never go to an exam without having had a look at the previous year's paper! Let's all work towards achieving that goal.

That's all folks! Have a nice week ahead!

Greetings, fine citizens of the realm! We hope your mid-semester exams went well.

As the library site was down for most part of mid-semester exams, our site MFQP was also rendered to be down initially. Hence, we would like to emphasize on our Paper Collection Drive for MFQP, and would like to request everyone to submit their mid-semester question papers for the benefit of fellow students.

Here's how you can contribute - Click, Upload & Send.

1. Take a picture of your question paper
2. Write Subject Code in email
3. Send to mfqp-source@googlegroups.com

And, do visit http://metakgp.github.io/mfqp-source/ 

That's all folks! Have a nice week ahead!

Want to know how to prepare for CFA Level 1? Read this guide written by Shugun Patel. 

https://wiki.metakgp.org/w/How_to_prepare_for_CFA_level_1

If you have some experience which you think will help KGPians, please add it directly to MetaKGP or send an email to metakgp@googlegroup.com

MFQP is working again. The library site for previous year papers has been down for most of this exam session, and since MFQP linked to the papers from there, the papers were not accessible. We have found a work-around now, and we are serving the papers from another file server. 

You can prepare productively with access to QPs again. (Note that this is an archive of papers from 2014, so papers from 2015 won't be available)

http://qp.metakgp.org/

With the blood-curdling countdown to midsems almost coming to an end, some of us would like to know what exactly the previous generations have faced. The Scholars' Avenue proudly presents to you the one stop shop for PYQPs, the sweat and blood of Metakgp and the unbuttoned sensation of KGP, http://qp.metakgp.org/

*The link is for the Previous Year Question Papers*

It's that time of the year again. Get started with your preparation for the mid semester exams with a few previous year Question Papers from MFQP!

If you are unable to see the question papers, add 10.0.0.0/8 to the proxy bypass list on your computer.

On Chrome, Go to Settings -> Advanced Settings -> Change proxy settings -> Now, add 10.0.0.0/8 to your proxy bypass list.

http://qp.metakgp.org/

story: Metakgp shared Kharagpur Open Source Society's photo.
message: Metakgp shared Kharagpur Open Source Society's photo. Time for the first event of this session! As they say, any good open source developer worth his (or her) salt uses Linux. As a part of introducing awareness about Open Source in the campus, KOSS, in association with Metakgp and IEEE Student Branch, IIT Kharagpur, is organising the Ubuntu Install Fest. Date: 4th September, Sunday Venue: Room 119 - CSE Department Time - 2 to 6 pm. Be there! Note: Please bring a pendrive along with your laptop, and ensure there is enough charge for the installation to complete smoothly. Written instructions: https://wiki.metakgp.org/w/How_to_install_Ubuntu_as_Dual_Boot

As a part of introducing awareness about Open Source in the campus, KOSS, in association with Metakgp and IEEE Student Branch, IIT Kharagpur, is organising the Ubuntu Install Fest. Date: 4th September, Sunday Venue: Room 119 - CSE Department Time - 2 to 6 pm. Be there! Note: Please bring a pendrive along with your laptop, and ensure there is enough charge for the installation to complete smoothly. Written instructions: https://wiki.metakgp.org/w/How_to_install_Ubuntu_as_Dual_Boot

Moving forward with our aim to curate information important to KGPians, we have started to collect "How To"s on metakgp. From guides about Institute formalities, like getting bonafide certificates and transcripts, to how-to's about travel and visas, our list goes on. The best thing is, metakgp is a wiki, this means **anyone** can edit it. So please add your own How To's to make things better.

https://wiki.metakgp.org/w/List_of_how-tos

We having a hackday tomorrow. In a hackday we come together and hack on something. **Absolutely everyone is invited**, it doesn't matter which year you are in, it doesn't matter whether you have been involved with metakgp or not and it doesn't matter if you know much programming or not. We believe everyone will have something to contribute and everyone will be able to learn something from the hackday. You can come with your own ideas or work with someone with the ideas listed below. The ideas need not be related to metaKGP or coding, for that matter.

Venue: Group Study Room, 2nd Floor Annex Building Central Library

Time: 1 PM to 8 PM

https://wiki.metakgp.org/w/Metakgp:Meetups/2016-08-07

The Metakgp Book Club is meeting today at 6:30 PM, Wednesday in the Discussion room, Annex Building, Central Library. You can hear people speak about a book they've read in recent past and later discuss it with the group. And of course, you're also invited to speak.

Check out https://wiki.metakgp.org/w/Metakgp:Book_Club

The Metakgp Book Club is meeting today at 6:30 PM, Wednesday in the Discussion room, Annex Building, Central Library. You can hear people speak about a book they've read in recent past and later discuss it with the group. And of course, you're also invited to speak.

Still confused about which Elective to take? Check the previous year grade distribution of your course on metakgp. Just Search for your course number or page. Unfortunately we don't have every page, but perfect is the enemy of good.

Still confused about which Elective to take? Check the previous year grade distribution of your course on metakgp. Just Search for your course number or page. Unfortunately we don't have every page, but perfect is the enemy of good.

https://wiki.metakgp.org/w/Main_Page

Next in our list of featured articles is **Table Tennis**.

"Table Tennis is one of the 13 sports which is a part of the General Championship during Inter IIT Sports Meet. IIT Kharagpur has a separate building (generally referred to as the Old Gymkhana) dedicated to Table Tennis, just behind the Volleyball Court and beside Iosys. It has 4 Stag 1000 DX table tennis boards, and a matted floor."

https://wiki.metakgp.org/w/Table_Tennis
